arts.ttl: Paul Warne's reaction said it all as 'charity free-kick' hurts Derby County
arts.sum: Paul Warne said it was hard to be critical of Derby County after their 1-1 draw against Plymouth but felt their lack of quality in the final third proved decisive. Warne's side continued to knock on the door as they searched for a second goal, but despite creating some good opportunities, they were punished when Adam Randell's free-kick took a deflection and sailed past Jacob Widell Zetterstrom.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney's relief said it all against 'best in the division' Derby County
arts.sum: Join our Derby County WhatsApp group to get the latest Rams headlines sent straight to your phone. Wayne Rooney praised Plymouth’s grit and resilience as he guided them to a rare away point on his first return to Pride Park since resigning as Derby County manager.

arts.ttl: Derby County player ratings v Plymouth as Rooney let off the hook
arts.sum: Derby got off to the perfect start when on-loan Swansea striker Yates scored his second goal in as many games when he produced a terrific overhead kick from a corner. Warne would have worried that a lack of a second goal had still left the door ajar for the visitors and that proved the case when Adam Randell levelled with a free-kick that deflected past Jacob Widell Zetterstrom.

arts.ttl: Plymouth hit back as Wayne Rooney earns draw at former club Derby
arts.sum: Paul Warne’s side could not translate their dominance into a commanding lead.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne makes triple Derby County change as he names team to face Plymouth
arts.sum: Derby (4-3-3): Zetterstrom, Wilson, Nelson, Phillips, Forsyth; Adams, Goudmijn, Thompson; Jackson, Yates, Mendez-Laing Warne's triple change is likely to lead to a return to a back four with Jacob Widell Zetterstrom in goal behind the quartet of Wilson, Curtis Nelson, Phillips and Forsyth.

arts.ttl: Derby County v Plymouth live updates as Wayne Rooney returns to Pride Park
arts.sum: Derby County will look to secure back-to-back victories in the Championship and sign off for the international break in style as they welcome Wayne Rooney back to Pride Park this afternoon. Click this link t o receive daily Derby County content and breaking news.

arts.ttl: Derby County open to loan move for midfielder
arts.sum: Robinson's hopes of becoming a first-team regular with the National League were hampered by international call-ups but Derby have not ruled out another loan move. Derby County are open to another loan for Darren Robinson despite his loan move from Hartlepool being cut short.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne reveals classy Mark Robins comments on Derby County win amid verdict on shock sacking
arts.sum: Paul Warne said Coventry City's decision to sack his old pal Mark Robins "shook him" and felt he was the manager who had the most job security in the Championship after his achievements at the Sky Blues. Warne reached out to Robins via text in the aftermath of the decision and speaking today, ahead of the Plymouth game at the weekend, said it had taken him by surprise.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne in fresh Derby County update over duo ahead of Wayne Rooney return
arts.sum: Corey Blackett-Taylor is fit and available to face Plymouth Argyle tomorrow but Callum Elder is out of Derby County's reunion with Wayne Rooney. Blackett-Taylor missed the win over Coventry City in midweek because of a minor issue with his hamstring, but that has been resolved in time in order for him to make the squad.

arts.ttl: What Paul Scholes did in secret for Sir Alex Ferguson to help Man Utd sign Wayne Rooney
arts.sum: Wayne Rooney joined Manchester United in 2004 in a £27million transfer from Everton and went on to become the Red Devils' all-time leading goalscorer during his 13-year spell at the club
